snippet: President Obama, speaking to an American television audience from an air base in Kabul, said he had traveled there to herald a new era in the relationship between the United States and Afghanistan.
abstract: President Obama, speaking to an American television audience from an air base in Kabul, says he had traveled there to herald a new era in the relationship between the United States and Afghanistan; address comes during an unannounced visit to sign a strategic partnership agreement with President Hamid Karzai that sets the terms for relations after the departure of American troops in 2014; it was also a chance for him to make an election-year case that he is winding down a costly and increasingly unpopular war.

byline.contributor: Elisabeth Bumiller contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: President Obama, speaking to an American television audience from an air base in Kabul, said he had traveled there to herald a new era in the relationship between the United States and Afghanistan.

headline.main: Obama Signs Pact in Kabul, Turning Page in Afghan War
headline.print_headline: Obama Signs Pact in Kabul, Turning Page in Long War
